awd_titl_txt: Development of Resonant Bar Gravitational Wave Antennae
awd_abstract_narration: The sensitivity of resonant bar gravitational wave                         detectors can potentially be increased by another two orders                    of magnitude.  A key step in achieving this goal is the                         development of novel electromechanical transducers.  Professor                  Bocko's research will seek to perfect a parametric transducer                   which converts extremely small mechanical vibrations of the                     bar antenna to an electrical signal by modulation of a                          capacitance in a superconducting radio-frequency bridge                         circuit.                                                                             This transducer design will be available to other groups                   to extend the range of the most advanced large antennas.  It                    will also allow the development of small receivers with                         interesting sensitivity levels for searches for gravitational                   waves in our galaxy.
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Mathematical and Physical Sciences
